item.title: Getting Started with AI Tab Categorization
item.description: TabNest's AI-powered categorization can save you hours of manual tab organization. Here's how to get started!
item.content:encoded:
TabNest's AI-powered categorization can save you hours of manual tab organization. Here's how to get started!

Why Use AI Categorization?‚Äã

  • Save Time - Organize hundreds of tabs in seconds
  • Smart Grouping - AI understands context and purpose
  • Easy Refinement - Review and adjust before applying
  • Multiple Providers - Choose the AI service you prefer

Step 1: Set Up Your AI Provider‚Äã

The easiest option is to use Claude from Anthropic:

  1. Get an API key from Anthropic Console
  2. Open TabNest Settings ‚Üí AI Configuration
  3. Add your Claude API key
  4. Click "Test Connection"

Step 2: Run Categorization‚Äã

  1. Save tabs you want to organize
  2. Click the ‚ö° AI Smart Categorize button
  3. Watch as AI analyzes and suggests groupings
  4. Review the results
  5. Click "Apply" to accept or "Cancel" to try again

Tips for Best Results‚Äã

  • Good tab titles matter - Pages with descriptive titles categorize better
  • Start small - Try with 10-20 tabs first
  • Iterate - Run categorization multiple times to refine
  • Combine with manual - AI + manual organization = perfect system

Cost Breakdown‚Äã

Using Claude:

  • Most categorization: $0.05-0.15
  • You pay only for what you use
  • Monitor your usage in the Anthropic dashboard

Troubleshooting‚Äã

Poor results?

  • Check that tabs have descriptive titles
  • Try a smaller batch
  • Try a different AI model

Connection errors?

  • Verify your API key is correct
  • Check your internet connection
  • Ensure your API key has sufficient credits

Next Steps‚Äã

  • Read the full AI documentation
  • Learn keyboard shortcuts for faster workflows
  • Set up cloud sync to keep your data safe

Enjoy your perfectly organized tabs!

item.title: TabNest v0.1.4 Release
item.description: We're excited to announce the release of TabNest v0.1.4 with major improvements and new features!
item.content:encoded:
We're excited to announce the release of TabNest v0.1.4 with major improvements and new features!

What's New‚Äã

‚ú® New Features‚Äã

  • AI-Powered Categorization - Automatically organize tabs using multiple AI providers (Claude, OpenAI, Bailian)
  • Cloud Sync - Sync your tabs to GitHub Gist or WebDAV
  • Global Search - Instantly find any tab across all your Spaces
  • Dark Mode - Beautiful dark theme with system preference support
  • Multi-language - Support for English and Simplified Chinese

üêõ Bug Fixes‚Äã

  • Fixed tab ordering issues
  • Improved performance with large collections
  • Enhanced keyboard navigation
  • Better error handling

üöÄ Performance‚Äã

  • 30% faster load times
  • Reduced memory usage
  • Optimized storage operations
  • Smoother animations

Getting Started‚Äã

  1. Install TabNest from Chrome Web Store
  2. Create your first Space
  3. Start saving and organizing your tabs!

Feedback‚Äã

We'd love to hear your feedback! Please visit our GitHub Issues page to report bugs or suggest features.

Thank You‚Äã

Thanks to all our users and contributors who helped make this release possible!

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.
item.content:encoded:
Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

Here are a few tips you might find useful.

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

  • 2019-05-30-welcome.md
  • 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

The blog supports tags as well!

And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

item.title: MDX Blog Post
item.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.
item.content:encoded:
Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

For example, use JSX to create an interactive button:

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

item.title: Long Blog Post
item.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,
item.content:encoded:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view.
